intro: Pedicularis cystopterides, commonly known as the yellow monkey orchid, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, often in association with other high-altitude flora. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
